metadata.Title: CVE-2009-4496 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Boa 0.94.14rc21 writes data to a log file without sanitizing non-printable characters, which might allow remote attackers to modify a window's title, or possibly execute arbitrary commands or overwrite files, via an HTTP request containing an escape sequence for a terminal emulator.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-4496` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

boa - 0.94.14rc21
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> if there is a problem, it is the terminal that has the issue

criterions.comment: boa package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.94.14rc21').
